main event: A brilliant blue-white, round, flat object with tailpipes was observed in Wilmington, North Carolina on 10 August 1953 for 3 1/2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as having brilliant tailpipes behind it.
The observation lasted for 3 1/2 minutes, providing a substantial timeframe for the sighting.
The report concluded that the object was unidentified.
No photographs or physical evidence were received to support the observation.
The sighting took place during a Ground-Visual observation.
sighted object: brilliant blue-white, round, flat object with tailpipes
